website_summaries.verdict: A good, affordable point-and-shoot digital camera that is small enough to fit in a pocket.
pros: Built-in image stabilization makes it easier to get clear pictures without any blur
Comes with a 8x optical zoom for closer shots from far away
cons: The image quality is limited to only 20 MP, lower than other point-and-shoot cameras

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful camera. If you’ve ever owned an ELPH camera, you know that they’re high-quality, ultra-portable cameras. Obviously you’re not going to get DSLR-quality images from a camera like this, but this is still a great camera, and if you use a tripod, you will be able to get excellent results. I use mine with an Amazon Basics tripod (which costs a little more than $20 and is really light and portable). Shooting with a tripod, even when using a little Point and Shoot camera, makes all the difference. But back to the camera. This is a great camera. It's also very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: NicholasTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a vacation or every day use.
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, I wasn't expecting much. But we were about to go on a cruise and I wanted a point and shoot that I could take on all our excursions (I have heard too many horror stories of phones dropped in the drink). I was replacing a more expensive camera. Quite honestly, the photos from this little camera are even better than my old camera - Clear, beautiful color, and excellent definition. The camera is easy to understand and use. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Book Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Cannon PowerShot ELPH 180
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect pocket camera. Very easy to use, small, light weight. I love the control button on the back side that allows me to quickly choose portrait shot or automatic ones. The rechargeable battery lasts a long time. The resolution is excellent. The 8X zoom is just right. I also own 2 Nikon Coolpix pocket cameras which worked very well, but over time no longer hold a battery charge. Then I recently purchased a cheap Chinese GordeVE pocket camera which I did not care for at all due to poor resolution, etc. I also own 2 Nikon SLRs which are superior cameras, but I don't always want to lug them around.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Ferencz

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: After opening my camera it worked great until it started to not charg... I have had this camera for 4 months and it’s now a glorified paperweight... I can’t do anything with it. I’ve already bought 2 new charging cables and a new battery and still nothing. Worst camera buy ever! I would not give it any starts but you have to give at least 1
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great P&S camera.
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking this abroad with me and it's perfectly sized for pockets, purses and backpacks. Though, I'd definitely recommend a small case if you'll be using it frequently like I will be on my travels (I puchased the Case Logic ECC-101 case and it fits great.) It takes great photos, too. It's quite user-friendly and comes with a full instruction manual, battery+plug-in wall charger and wrist strap. Easy and simple to navigate. I also purchased a 32GB SDHC card and a small, hard-sided travel case for it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The battery worked for 1 weekend now it swells up whenever I charge it. I haven't gotten the opportunity to comment on the actual camera due to not being able to turn it on
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Camera
customer_reviews.text: I just don't like taking pictures with my phone, so wanted to replace an older Canon digital camera. Got this based on the price and what I read in other reviews. Have taken quite a few pictures with it on several vacations (mostly scenery) and am quite pleased. It is easy to use, the zoom is all I need for my vacation pictures. Battery life is great, love the color--lightweight, easy to use. As long as it continues to hold up, I will be very pleased I chose this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Ray

customer_reviews.title: Go with the Sony Cybershot It's Better
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst pocket digital camera I've owned since 2000. Feels cheap because it is and the quality if the images are grainy and not as vibrant as the Sony equilivant. I purchased this camera to replace my Sony Cybershot W830. I use it for work and needed a camera asap so I couldn't return it or I would have.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty80Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cheap simple point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I've bought maybe 20 of these cameras over the years for my company. They are cheap and get the job done for building inspections. Very simple to use and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzy pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I have been unable to get a clear picture with this camera. Unfortunately, I tried too long and now cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Alexy

customer_reviews.title: what amazon doesn’t tell you.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new computer, came with memory Installed, worked great Bought a CD/DVD drive, came with a cable to hook it up to my computer. Then I bought this camera. Opened up the box, no memory card, so it won’t work. Want to down load pictures to my computer, oops no cable. Now you would think that amazon would tell you this, but all they want you to see is the low price. Sort of like buying a new car, only to find out that there is no motor.
customer_reviews.author: N. W. House

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to make high quality photos. After having it about 6 months I find it produces pictures no better in quality than my iPhone 5, perhaps a bit less. Pictures are not sharp, camera modes are difficult to discern and adjust, no exposure adjustments. Do not buy this camera, spend a little more and get the good optics. My partner has an older Nikon, cost about $60 more and produces superior photos, especially when enlarged.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Isganitis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It was a good camera for two weeks then it died to work no more.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Swaim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It's not so good and the description is misleading. This camera does not have Optical Image Stabilization like it says in the opening description. I contacted Canon directly and they said: The image stabilization in the PowerShot ELPH 180 is electronic, not optical. So it goes back. The pictures are clear as long as you're outdoors, kinda fuzzy indoors. The video is clear but it's shaky. See sample. Just like a smartphone without image stabilization. You can tell it's not 1080. It's just not worth the price, $115 with tax. I got theon order.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: quality option for a basic digital camera but better if could recharge battery without taking it out
customer_reviews.text: This is an acceptable solution for a basic photo operation I have setup where this is mounted on a tripod looking down onto a workstation. I wanted something cheap with not too many frills and that would have the threaded mount on the bottom of the camera. This is good to go and I have no complaints about the product other than that the batter cannot charge in-situ such as other cameras I have had where the battery charging cable can plug directly to the camera with the batter still int he camera... with this product the battery must be removed and charged in a wall mounted charger.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use camera
customer_reviews.text: The little camera is easy to use and carry. It takes good enough pics for sight seeing for me. I do have to be careful with the little metal slide that opens and closes over the battery/memory card holder, I think it might break easily. Other than that, it is a good little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Will not Focus
customer_reviews.text: I started having focus problems with this camera early on. For a while, if I turned the camera on and off, I could get it to focus. It is now permanently out of focus. The camera has never been dropped, gotten wet or had any sort of damage. This is simply a defect that is inherent in the camera. I will not buy any more Canon cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: The camera comes without battery or memory card. Worse, it comes without a user's manual. There is a useless "getting started" booklet. To get a user's manual one must either print out over 100 pages from a web site OR call Canon and BUY the user's manual. The process of buying takes about 20 minutes and costs $12. This is a new low in customer "service." When a company nickels and dimes like this, one might conclude its ethics might well generally allow for degraded products and service. CAVEAT EMPTOR.
customer_reviews.author: JJR

customer_reviews.title: Buy the red ELPH 180--has software updates!
customer_reviews.text: The silver camera does not have all the updated software, but the red ELPH 180 does. Buy the red one!
customer_reviews.author: ZAKIBK

customer_reviews.title: Rugged point and shoot useful for many applications.
customer_reviews.text: I use it at work to photo equipment; easily cleaned for moving in and out of clean rooms. Excellent photographic quality.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not a Bad Camera, But Not Perfect, Either
customer_reviews.text: A decent camera but, like many compact cameras (and some larger, more expensive ones), not easy to set for particular shots (low light, flash, telephoto, etc.). For close-up snapshots, it's fine. I carry it with me and, over time, I may figure out ways to get better photos--but I shouldn't have to. Controls should be intuitive and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Dharma

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This handy little camera is not going to take national geographic photos but it will fit in your pocket, take decent shots and will be easy to use. The only problem you will have is that you still have to use a memory card and there are less and less places to use those for removing photos off the camera. It was perfect to take on vacation and not a big deal if it got lost or broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I make slideshows to be used for entertainment in nursing homes. I needed a small camera to compliment my larger digital cameras. I pulled this little one out and took some random shots using auto focus and image stabilization. I really didn't expect any of them to come out. The day was incredibly bright and I was on the water for some of them. I just pointed and shot expecting nothing. I was pleasantly surprised with the results. Nearly every one I took is usable. I'm going to pack this little guy on all my shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J.

customer_reviews.title: Loses focus some times. Video gets purple lines if ...
customer_reviews.text: Loses focus some times. Video gets purple lines if too bright back ground lighting. Not acceptable of course. Returned. What's with Canon cameras lately? Tired a couple and they are all sub-par,
customer_reviews.author: James S. Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my last digital camera
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great little camera. It even fits a 15 year old elph case I had from my old original elph. Fits in my pocket. The Auto settings were not the best for indoor dance competitions. I went into "P" Programming settings. I sped up the ISO, and it worked really well. My last other popular brand point-and-shoot had a terrible blur problem, no matter what I did with it. So I went back to Canon, and could not be happier with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Camera cannot download by cable to computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the red version of the Canon power shot Elph 180 and added the USB cord that was advertised for downloading photos. I am very disappointed that the only way to download photos is by removing the memory card and inserting in the computer slot. This is really poor advertising. I also wish there was a way to send the photos to a cell phone or ipad. I should have bought a more expensive model, but I wanted something simple to use. It is simple to use, but the memory card is difficult to access and it was not as advertised. Perhaps the silver version has the USB connection?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to Keep in Purse
customer_reviews.text: This is very small and light for keeping in your purse all the time, in case you don't have one of the really expensive cell phone cameras. It takes quite good photos on Automatic under a variety of conditions; and it has a number of useful settings in the Program mode. It's operation is easy to understand, and is intuitive so you don't have to memorize anything. I particularly like that it captures vivid color under almost all lighting conditions. My only complaint is that the battery/card compartment is hard to open - requires a hard push with my thumbnail.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: would rather have batteries
customer_reviews.text: The camera is nice, works well, but I was disappointed that it came with a charger instead of batteries. With my old Canon camera, I always carried batteries right with it so if they went dead, I could still use the camera. With the charger, if the camera goes dead you are out of luck unless you are taking pictures in a home or business and can recharge it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sojda

customer_reviews.title: Quality is blase.
customer_reviews.text: Have this camera 3 years now and aside from daylight shots, the photos taken everyplace else inside, at night etc, never seem to match up to the hellishly good photos taken on my prior Canon cameras where I could aim at the crescent moon and get the moon and the planet Venus I think it is, and it comes out with zoom so clearly. This camera always seemed to produce tired photos no matter what. I am hoping that a newer Canon, maybe with a little more cash investment will end up being satisfactory as these onetime reasonable priced and quality filled powershots models are a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was truly disappointed with this camera, but in all fairness I shouldn't have expected much based on the price. I really just wanted a good point and shoot camera without having to fidget around with a bunch of settings. I've since bought a Samsung Note 9 that takes excellent photos. I've giving this camera 3 stars only because it looks nice and the quality of camera body seems good. Quality of photos and too many controls I can't remember what to do with knocks off the other two stars. I've had plenty of cameras over the years so I'm not new to cameras, but this one was really for a child.
customer_reviews.author: G Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Battery will not hold a charge - and it's brand new - !
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nice because it is so small - almost miniature - but that is all I like. Battery will not hold a charge. Assuming this one is defective or old from product being in storage before shipping, but it is unreasonable to ask a buyer to spend $30-$40 more on a new battery when the product is advertised as coming with a battery. The download process is slow, and way more complicated that is needs to be. Comparing this one to my old Canon Powershot A480 . . ..This is a low-end model,, so if you are considering Canon go a little higher price and get a better quality camera, I am disappointed . . ...
customer_reviews.author: carolart5

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Powershot
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera everyday for work. This is my 3rd power shot. The first is still being used occasionally by my wife, the second got water logged in my pocket so I stole the battery and memory card and pitched the rest, the third is in use and will be for several more years before I destroy it in some unintended stupid way. Get one, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome R. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I wanted to take pictures faster than what my Samsung was capable of doing. It does the the job I want very well but the sensor is problematic in low light conditions, My Samsung would take a picture in the darkest conditions, not a problem but the Canon will not do that. The Canon will refuse to work in very low light conditions but I have had to adapt to that by bringing light in to the picture, and then it works. It takes pictures fast which is what I wanted but it could use some improvements.
customer_reviews.author: HYPER

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fiddling to get the picture you want
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to find all the controls in the menus (ie the exposure compensation, ISO range settings). The instructions are pretty vague. This camera only comes with a battery and a wall charger. No cords are included. You have to remove the battery from the camera to charge it. You have to either buy a cord or remove the memory card each time you want to download pictures. It is capable of taking some decent pictures if the lighting is sufficient. This camera does not take good night time pictures, even on a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Capers

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I've tried larger, fancier, more expensive cameras for a number of years, but the ones in my mid-price range never seem to perform as advertised. Plus they're big and awkward to carry around for spontaneous shots. The Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 has been absolutely perfect for my needs. No frills, no bells and whistles, just good photos.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle Dove

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge over USB
customer_reviews.text: You can't charge the battery over the USB cord, you have to pop it out and use the special charger. Getting the battery out and back in, facing the right way is very difficult for older people with limited vision and dexterity. If I had know, I wouldn't have purchased the camera. Otherwise, it is a good little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality was not as good as the first two I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Third ELPH camera I'd bought, as a replacement for another I'd thought I'd lost. Picture quality was not as good as the first two I've owned. Was glad I found the lost one so I had another option on my trip. Also the settings were not easily manipulated and some were missing from the previous version. I gave it to some of the kids on our mission trip to use and they broke the lens mechanism so the lens would no longer contract. they weren't that rough with it, but the lens became bent. Pretty cheaply made and not worth repairing. Won't order again.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Made of plastic
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed when this arrived to find it incredibly light weight and felt rather cheap -- all plastic. I owned the same model from 5 years ago and LOVED it. I just felt like the gates to the the ports and battery were ready to snap off at a moment's notice on this newer model. I need something a little more sturdy for my clumsy soul.
customer_reviews.author: Married in PB

customer_reviews.title: No customer service from Canon
customer_reviews.text: I realize this is not the most expensive camera, but I expected it to last longer than a year. We cannot get the camera to turn on even though the battery charger registers fully charged with the green light. Called Canon and were basically told too bad. I expected so much more from a Canon camera, but I guess the quality has diminished. Will not buy a Canon camera again. Now that is TOO BAD for consumers.
customer_reviews.author: stacy brainard

customer_reviews.title: No SD card or cable to download!
customer_reviews.text: bought this little camera for my dad off the reviews alone (meaning great overall stars with a lot of reviews). Come to find out it doesn't come with a SD card and therefore cannot save ANY pictures. I assumed you could save some just not a ton. AND it doesn't come with the basic cable to download them to your computer. I thought i was spending extra to get some extra features and little did I know i wasn't even getting the bare minimum! Hard pass!
customer_reviews.author: Legend Med

customer_reviews.title: THE QUALITY IS NOT GREAT PICTURES ARE FAIR
customer_reviews.text: NOT SO GREAT IN PICTURES, THOUGH I NEEDED CAMERA, I ALSO WANTED USB AND I GOT ONE TODAY, AND IT WORKS WITH THIS CAMERA, IF YOU NEED ONE==AND ITS REALLY CHEAP, ON AMAZON. UGREEN Mini USB Cable USB 2.0 Type A to Mini B Cable Data Charging Cord Compatible for GoPro Hero 3+, Hero HD, PS3 Controller, Phone, MP3 Player, Dash Cam, Digital Camera, SatNav, GPS Receiver,PDA 3ft, SO , YOU CAN TRASFER PHOTOS OVER USB TO THE LAPTOP , THATS WHAT I DID
customer_reviews.author: Lara Fish

customer_reviews.title: Fine Basic Digital Camera for a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine digital camera for one looking for a very reasonably priced one. It is very easy to set up and use, and the images it captures are generally admirable. The instruction guide could have provided more detail, and more expensive cameras should be able to take sharper photos. But for someone not interested in spending lots of money, this camera is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gevirtz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lightweight camera.
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera as it is easy to use, compact, and lightweight. Takes nice pictures. It is hard to get it to focus on the correct subject when doing close ups of flowers and such. The major feature I dislike is that there is no way to force a flash to fill in for when the subject is backlit.
customer_reviews.author: Obi-one-Gwynobi

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old granddaughter asked for a camera for her birthday so she could shoot videos. This one was reasonably priced and has worked well for her. She hasn't needed much help with anything except downloading. I bought one grandchild a much cheaper camera a few years ago and it was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: hpm

customer_reviews.title: Auto focus trouble but neat little camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera, maybe it's me and my husbands fault but we can not get it to focus, weve messed with it so much and nothing seems to help it. It's a neat little camera and in the right situation takes nice photos, but if the lighting is off even a little this camera can not deal with it. We have a $1500 canon camera as well that I'll use when were inside and for holidays, this little camera does however serve its purpose as a little pocket camera to take hiking and into more dangerous areas that the big camera might not hold up so well in.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera, convenient light wight and high definition photos.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny for a fast and convenient tiny pocket camera. Bought it for my mom as a mother's day present. Originally bought a generic camera that supposed to have high definition and resolution, pixelation and all. Came yo realize it was useless and embarrassed with a bad product as a present. Returned it and got this camera, it was so different and so happy I did. Love canon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes decent quality photos for the price point, but inferior to modern phones. Placement of buttons makes taking photos awkward (your thumb can hit a number of buttons). 3.5-4 stars
customer_reviews.author: sergio lopresti

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: This Canon 180 is pretty good but not as good as the ELPH190. The 190 is a little better with more functions. I take alot of picture and am pretty tuff on cameras. I have noticed over time that the newer cameras do not hold up as good as the older ones. I bought the ELPH110 HS and that lasted longer than the 190. We will see what this 180 can do. I am around 10000 pictures and its holding well. The battery will fad over time. Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for my 6 yo to use
customer_reviews.text: My 6 yo loves taking pics of everything. He was using my 15 year old digit camera, so this has been a nice, affordable upgrade for him. He had no problems figuring out how to use it. It came with a wrist strap, but we couldn’t get it on, so I rigged up another strap with thin nylon cord I had. It’s a removable battery that you have to take out to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: this is my third Canon camera and it stopped working six weeks after I received it. The camera only turns on for a second. The lens extends and the camera shuts off. I try to turn it back on and the lens retracts then shuts off again and it no longer works. I believe this is a defect with the camera and it's now past the returns so I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: relatively low price for a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for a road trip so my daughter could take lots of pictures without clogging up her phone. It's very easy to learn to use. It takes great pictures - especially at a distance, or while driving! It's on the small side, so it can fit in a regular purse. Better for school events where we're sitting way back in the audience - nice zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed backpacker.  Returned
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Disappointed backpacker. Did not imagine that any camera these days would only charge through the battery charger that comes with it. For the outdoors person you will have no way to charge. Purchased the Sony that is similar. It will charge from a potable battery pack if you are out backpacking etc... No need to even remove the battery.
customer_reviews.author: kindersir

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews before making this purchase but decided to try. So thankful that I did! This camera went on a vacation with us and took amazingly clear pictures.
customer_reviews.author: brandon653

customer_reviews.title: It’s........cool, I guess
customer_reviews.text: It’s alright for beginning to learn how to do photography. I was kinda hoping I could zoom in and take pics of like bugs and stuff but naw it gets wicked blurry. Like zooming in is a no go if you want nice pictures bro. Feels good in your hands though! I wanna try to be positive you know? Cause I like it. But if you want goods pics dude I’d look at another one
customer_reviews.author: sparrow

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I didn't like was it did not come with a memory card
customer_reviews.text: It is compact, yet has many features. It takes pictures much faster than my older Canon PowerShot. The only thing I didn't like was it did not come with a memory card, so I had to purchase that separately.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent digital camera for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, excellent website! The website even recommends a memory chip and a cable for transferring pictures from the camera to a laptop computer. So I didn't need any prior knowledge about how to find a memory chip that fits into the camera or a cable that is compatible with both the camera and my laptop. And everything fits and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: JohnJ

customer_reviews.title: Great digital camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon ELPH. I had my first one for 10 years and have now passed it on to my daughter. This is a basic digital camera with a great view finder and it delivers excellent pictures. I love the small size which can easily fit into a pocket or my purse. It is great to use for every day pictures and for an upcoming vacation. It does not come with a cord to connect the camera up to the computer, but I always take my memory card out and put that in the computer to see my photos.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: Handy.  Easy to use.  Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: A replacement for a very similar earlier monitor that did not survive a pass through a washing machine (although the battery and SD card did!). Handy, easy to use, reasonably clear photos with OK resolution. Zoom function is a bit rough (jerky). Good little camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures
customer_reviews.text: This little camera surprised me. I didn't expect this. It is extremely easy to use and takes excellent pictures. My only dislike is removing the card to copy pictures and removing the battery to charge it. For the price it is an excellent buy. I recommend it highly. If it ever wears out I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Freezeland

customer_reviews.title: No USB cable included
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is my fault that I did not review this purchase closely enough to realize it was not WiFi capable. That's on me. But how am I supposed to view the pictures on anything more than the small screen on the camera itself without a USB cable to connect it to my PC or even phone to upload pics to Google photos like my phone does. I have ordered the correct cable and I'm not overly concerned about the additional price. I would have preferred to pay slightly higher a price to have avoided the inconvenience. If I'm not understanding the properties of the camera correctly, please enlighten me.
customer_reviews.author: JE White

customer_reviews.title: I suppose I thought maybe I was taking the photos in bad lighting, but I genuinely think the camera just ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've returned this when I had the chance. I suppose I thought maybe I was taking the photos in bad lighting, but I genuinely think the camera just sucks. Don't waste your money. Go to bestbuy or somewhere you can try the cameras out before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Description false: no Optical Image Stabilization
customer_reviews.text: This camera has Digital Image Stabilization which is as ineffective as "digital zoom." Besides the falsity of the description, the lack of effective stabilization makes even worse the slow f3.2 lens at widest opening. Useless unless in bright sunlight. Not worth even the apparently low price offered.
customer_reviews.author: Wit Held By Request

customer_reviews.title: Not canons best pocket device
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera for the price point for a nine year old to learn photography and her slime channel. Build quality is very bad though, not at all what I expect from canon. I am a professional photographer who shoots mostly canon and fujifilm. This is far below any cheap pocket canon I have ever purchased before, the plastic body feels like it will break at any moment.
customer_reviews.author: Littlehorns

customer_reviews.title: Would not turn on ~ Will be returning
customer_reviews.text: I charged the battery in the charger (light goes from orange to green) and then could not get the camera to turn on ~ I knew many reviewers with low-star review said they could not get it to turn on, but with free returns I gave it a chance. I will be returning this item and all accessories that I bought for it for a refund and looking elsewhere for a compact digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Daily Bread

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:Red| Style:BaseMake the most of special occasions with the Canon Powershot ELPH 180 HS Digital Camera. Capture your favorite moments in stunning 720p HD video. Plus, you won't get behind on the action with smart auto selects to find the proper settings. From the Manufacturer: Slim. Stylish. Simple. For those wanting a simple way to capture moments with family, friends and more, the slim, stylish PowerShot ELPH 180 camera has easy-to-use features to help create photos that are as stunning as you want. The 8x Optical Zoom lets you get close to the action, while the 20.0 Megapixel* CCD sensor with DIGIC 4+ Image Processor help produce vibrant, clear images to share or print. Take more than just still images, with the ability to record movies at 720p HD. Do not use organic solvents such as alcohol, benzine, or thinner to clean the product, Operating Temperature:32-104°F / 0-40°C.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

SLIM. STYLISH. SIMPLE.
For those wanting a simple way to capture moments with family, friends and more, the slim, stylish PowerShot ELPH 180 camera has easy-to-use features to help create photos that are as stunning as you want. The 8x Optical Zoom lets you get close to the action, while the 20.0 Megapixel* CCD sensor with DIGIC 4+ Image Processor help produce vibrant, clear images to share or print. Take more than just still images, with the ability to record movies at 720p HD. For added convenience, Smart AUTO figures out suitable settings for what you're photographing so you don't have to worry about finding a picture mode yourself. To help reduce the effects of camera shake, Digital IS helps keep blur to a minimum. On top of that, the Auto Zoom feature can automatically close in on your subject and keep it in focus for easy shooting.

* Image processing may cause a decrease in the number of pixels.

8X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER HELPS YOU CAPTURE IMAGES WITH FLEXIBILITY AND EASE
The PowerShot ELPH 180 camera features an 8x Optical Zoom so more shots are within your reach. You'll love the flexibility that the wide 28–224mm (35mm equivalent) shooting range offers. Plus, the wide-angle lens captures an expansive image in each shot, adding depth, perspective and grandeur. Landscapes, city scenes, family shots and more benefit from the extra width. Whether you're shooting wide group shots or zooming to the telephoto end, your images will be bright and clear.

20.0 MEGAPIXEL* CCD SENSOR COMBINES WITH THE DIGIC 4+ IMAGE PROCESSOR TO HELP DELIVER STUNNING IMAGE QUALITY
20.0 MEGAPIXEL* SENSOR
With the PowerShot ELPH 180 camera's 20.0 Megapixels* of resolution, your images are rich and clear, with textures and tiny details faithfully reproduced even at the long end of the 8x Optical Zoom. This high level of resolution can be ideal for creating large prints, and allows you the flexibility to blow up and crop any section of an image to express your creativity.

DIGIC 4+ IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot ELPH 180 camera's DIGIC 4+ Image Processor features accelerated processing speed to create fast, responsive performance, giving you a shooting experience that's easy and natural. The DIGIC 4+ Image Processor also enhances image quality in several ways. Processing of high ISO shots has been shortened by up to 60% compared to the DIGIC 4 Image Processor. This helps significantly reduce noise for brilliant color, smooth gradations and beautiful detail even in low light. The processor's highly efficient design also extends battery life.

* Image processing may cause a decrease in the number of pixels.

CAPTURE 720P HD VIDEO
Using the slim PowerShot ELPH 180 camera, you can shoot high-definition video when you want, where you want. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to quickly record moments in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special memories.

SMART AUTO INTELLIGENTLY SELECTS THE PROPER SETTINGS BASED ON PREDEFINED SHOOTING SITUATIONS
Click here for a larger image Getting that great shot can be as simple as pressing the shutter button on the PowerShot ELPH 180 camera. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject and analyzes them using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to help facilitate incredible image capture, whether you're shooting stills or video. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

DIGITAL IS HELPS REDUCE THE EFFECT OF CAMERA SHAKE AND SUBJECT MOVEMENT
Sometimes even the steadiest of hands can move a little, and during night photos or when zoomed in close, even a small shudder can blur a photo. Digital IS on the PowerShot ELPH 180 camera analyzes the image in order to electronically remove blur and fuzzy edges, helping to ensure you get a clear picture.

SCENE MODES SUCH AS FISHEYE EFFECT, TOY CAMERA EFFECT AND MONOCHROME PROVIDE CREATIVE FREEDOM TO CAPTURE YOUR PHOTOS
The PowerShot ELPH 180 camera provides shooting modes that can easily give your shots a distinctly artistic feel without the need for any extra lenses and filters. You can make a quirky portrait using the Fisheye Effect or add a beautiful single-tone effect with Monochrome. Toy Camera Effect simulates a vintage look as if capturing the photo using a “toy” or pinhole camera. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Face Self-timer The camera waits for a face to enter the frame before releasing the shutter. Low Light For high-quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with “toy” or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects Black-and-White, Sepia or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Actual results may vary from examples shown above.
Final image may vary depending on picture composition.

ENABLE THE AUTO ZOOM FEATURE AND YOUR CAMERA WILL AUTOMATICALLY ZOOM IN TO HELP FRAME YOUR SUBJECT AND HELP KEEP IT IN FOCUS
Now, beautifully framed shots using the powerful 8x Optical Zoom are as easy as pressing the Auto Zoom button. With Auto Zoom, the camera automatically determines the correct size and framing by detecting the number of subjects. The system also detects faces that are too small, then zooms in to the proper length. Auto Zoom is a great feature for spontaneous everyday shooting, and especially useful for times when someone else (even a child) is using your camera, for instance at a tourist spot.

ECO MODE HELPS REDUCE POWER CONSUMPTION FOR LONGER BATTERY LIFE
The PowerShot ELPH 180 camera features ECO Mode to help provide a high number of shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. The mode can be activated via a dedicated button for easy power preservation when you are out for the day or the moment is too important to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed so you won't miss the moment.

HELP BUTTON PROVIDES SIMPLE EXPLANATIONS AND EASY CONTROL OF YOUR SETTINGS
The PowerShot ELPH 180 camera is designed to be fun and easy to use, even for beginners. A Help Button on the camera's exterior brings up the help menu when you need it, right on the LCD screen. From here, you can scroll through a variety of topics that answer your questions with clear explanations, offer helpful shooting advice and show you diagrams highlighting the position of any buttons you'll need.
